claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.

extracted_evidence.quote: Flublok Quadrivalent (Sanofi Pasteur) 0.5 mL PFS ≥18 yrs 45 µg/0.5 mL IM
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote shows that Flublok contains 45 µg of hemagglutinin (HA) antigen per 0.5 mL dose, which is three times the 15 µg/0.5 mL dose found in standard-dose flu vaccines, directly supporting the first part of the claim.

extracted_evidence.quote: Fluzone Quadrivalent (Sanofi Pasteur) 0.5-mL PFS ≥6 mos 15 µg/0.5 mL IM
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote provides the HA antigen content for a standard-dose flu vaccine (15 µg/0.5 mL), which, when compared to Flublok's 45 µg/0.5 mL, confirms the '3x' antigen content claim.
